answerText: Nernst equation [10] You can derive the Nernst equation by messing around with the change in entropy and then plugging it into the expression for the change in thermodynamic quantity, equal to the change in enthalpy minus the temperature times the change in the entropy
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | Harvard | 13 | Science | Chemistry | College
subject: Science
question: Question: It has half-cell and full-cell forms, the former of which invokes the ratio of two chemical activities, whereas the latter in the same place uses the reaction quotient. For 10 points each:  [10] Identify this fundamental equation of electrochemistry.
